description: This file implements the core functions for an HTTP Authentication object, including creation, initialization, and removal. It defines methods to handle authentication processes such as generating challenges and responses, and verifying auth info.

classes.name: HTTP_AUTH_OBJECT
classes.description: The main object representing HTTP Authentication, including methods for different authentication operations and state management.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE HttpAuthoCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs and initializes a new HTTP Authentication object.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpAuthoRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the HTTP Authentication object, freeing resources.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpAuthoEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enrolls any subordinate objects required by this HTTP Auth object.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpAuthoInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes the HTTP Auth object, setting up function pointers and state variables.
